<hr class="section-divider">

In this blogpost, I share some fun, interactive and quirky bioinformatics tools and webpages I've come across through the years.

So if you are ready... let's dive in!

<hr class="section-divider">

Because learning bioinformatics doesn't have to be boring! Here are some of the most engaging and entertaining resources:

### Interactive Visualizations and Explanations

<ul>
<li>[**Understanding UMAP**](https://pair-code.github.io/understanding-umap/) – Gorgeous interactive explanation of UMAP dimensionality reduction. Play with parameters in real-time!</li>
<li>[**Seeing Theory**](https://seeing-theory.brown.edu/) – Beautiful, interactive visualizations of probability and statistics. Best stats visualization site ever.</li>
<li>[**The Evolution of Trust**](https://ncase.me/trust/) – Interactive game theory explanation relevant to evolutionary biology.</li>
<li>[**Complexity Explorables**](https://www.complexity-explorables.org/) – Interactive explorations of complex systems and biological models.</li>
<li>[**Distill.pub**](https://distill.pub/) – Machine learning concepts explained with incredible interactive visualizations.</li>
<li>[**R2D3: Visual Intro to Machine Learning**](http://www.r2d3.us/) – Stunning scrollytelling explanation of ML concepts.</li>
<li>[**Explorable Explanations**](https://explorabl.es/) – Collection of interactive, playful explanations of complex topics.</li>
</ul>

### Fun (and not so useful) R Packages

<ul>
<li>[**genzplyr**](https://hadley.github.io/genzplyr/) – dplyr but make it Gen Z. Use `yeet()` instead of `select()`, `vibe_check()` for validation. No cap fr fr.</li>
<li>[**cowsay**](https://github.com/sckott/cowsay) – Make animals say things in your R console. Essential for debugging (obviously).</li>
<li>[**praise**](https://github.com/rladies/praise) – Get random praise when your code works. We all need this.</li>
<li>[**fortune**](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/fortunes/) – Random R fortunes and quotes from the R community.</li>
<li>[**BRRR**](https://github.com/brooke-watson/BRRR) – Make your R script say "BRRR" like Gucci Mane when it finishes.</li>
<li>[**CatterPlots**](https://github.com/Gibbsdavidl/CatterPlots) – Scatter plots with cats. Because data visualization needs more cats.</li>
<li>[**ggcats**](https://github.com/R-CoderDotCom/ggcats) – Add cat images to your ggplot2 plots as points.</li>
</ul>

### Gamified Learning

<ul>
<li>[**Phylo**](https://phylo.cs.mcgill.ca/) – Puzzle game where you do real multiple sequence alignments. Citizen science gaming!</li>
<li>[**Eterna**](https://eternagame.org/) – Design RNA molecules through puzzle-solving. Your solutions get synthesized in real labs!</li>
<li>[**Foldit**](https://fold.it/) – Protein folding puzzle game. Players have contributed to real scientific discoveries.</li>
<li>[**Rosalind**](http://rosalind.info/) – Learn bioinformatics through programming challenges. Level up your skills RPG-style.</li>
<li>[**Regex Golf**](https://alf.nu/RegexGolf) – Master regular expressions (essential for bioinformatics) through addictive challenges.</li>
<li>[**Vim Adventures**](https://vim-adventures.com/) – Learn Vim commands through a Zelda-like game. Useful for command-line bioinformatics.</li>
</ul>

### Quirky Educational Content

<ul>
<li>[**StatQuest**](https://www.youtube.com/@statquest) – Josh Starmer's incredibly catchy stats songs. "BAM!" You'll never forget PCA again.</li>
<li>[**PhD Comics**](http://phdcomics.com/) – Grad school life comics. Too real for bioinformatics students.</li>
<li>[**XKCD**](https://xkcd.com/) – Randall Munroe's nerdy comics. Search for bioinformatics, statistics, and data science ones.</li>
<li>[**Lior Pachter's Blog**](https://liorpachter.wordpress.com/) – Sometimes spicy, always entertaining takes on computational biology.</li>
</ul>

### Fun Visualization Tools

<ul>
<li>[**Nextstrain**](https://nextstrain.org/) – Real-time tracking of pathogen evolution. Watch viruses evolve live.</li>
<li>[**Sequence Bunny**](https://nucleic.acid.science/sequencebunny/) – Turn DNA sequences into adorable bunnies. Each sequence makes a unique bunny!</li>
<li>[**DNA Chisel**](https://edinburgh-genome-foundry.github.io/DnaChisel/) – Optimize DNA sequences with fun constraint options.</li>
<li>[**Proteopedia**](https://proteopedia.org/) – Wikipedia for protein structures, but 3D and interactive.</li>
<li>[**MolView**](https://molview.org/) – Quick and easy molecule visualization in your browser.</li>
</ul>

### Creative Data Science

<ul>
<li>[**Dear Data**](http://www.dear-data.com/) – Hand-drawn data visualizations project. Inspiration for presenting bioinformatics data artistically.</li>
<li>[**Data is Ugly Subreddit**](https://www.reddit.com/r/dataisugly/) – Learn what NOT to do with your plots. Hilariously bad visualizations.</li>
<li>[**Data is Beautiful Subreddit**](https://www.reddit.com/r/dataisbeautiful/) – Gorgeous data visualizations for inspiration.</li>
<li>[**Flowing Data**](https://flowingdata.com/) – Nathan Yau's creative and fun approach to data visualization.</li>
</ul>

### Meme-Worthy Resources

<ul>
<li>[**Bioinformatics Memes**](https://www.reddit.com/r/bioinformatics/) – r/bioinformatics for the culture. Commiserate over installation issues.</li>
<li>[**Computational Biology Memes**](https://www.instagram.com/comp_bio_memes/) – Instagram account with relatable computational biology humor.</li>
<li>[**Science Side of Tumblr**](https://tumblr.com/tagged/science) – Chaotic good science explanations and memes.</li>
<li>[**I Fucking Love Science**](https://www.ifls.com/) – Popular science with personality.</li>
</ul>

### Interactive Tools and Playgrounds

<ul>
<li>[**Genetic Algorithm Walkers**](https://rednuht.org/genetic_walkers/) – Watch creatures evolve to walk using genetic algorithms. Mesmerizing!</li>
<li>[**The Coding Train**](https://thecodingtrain.com/) – Daniel Shiffman's creative coding tutorials. Many biological simulations!</li>
<li>[**Observable**](https://observablehq.com/@observablehq/plot) – Interactive JavaScript notebooks for data visualization. Great for web-based bioinfo viz.</li>
<li>[**Streamlit Gallery**](https://streamlit.io/gallery) – Collection of interactive data science apps. Many genomics examples!</li>
</ul>

### Unconventional Learning

<ul>
<li>[**Papers We Love**](https://paperswelove.org/) – Community celebrating computer science and bioinformatics papers with meetups.</li>
<li>[**Two Minute Papers**](https://www.youtube.com/@TwoMinutePapers) – AI and computational research explained in 2 minutes. Includes computational biology.</li>
<li>[**3Blue1Brown**](https://www.youtube.com/@3blue1brown) – Beautiful mathematical animations. Linear algebra and calculus for bioinformatics.</li>
<li>[**Primer**](https://www.youtube.com/@PrimerBlobs) – Evolution and natural selection explained through cute blob simulations.</li>
</ul>

### Easter Eggs and Fun Commands

<ul>
<li>[**curl wttr.in**](https://wttr.in/) – Weather in your terminal. Because bioinformaticians live in terminals.</li>
<li>[**curl parrot.live**](https://github.com/hugomd/parrot.live) – Party parrot in your terminal for when your pipeline finally finishes!</li>
<li>[**cowsay + lolcat**](https://github.com/busyloop/lolcat) – Combine cowsay with rainbow colors. Peak terminal aesthetics.</li>
<li>[**hollywood**](https://github.com/dustinkirkland/hollywood) – Make your terminal look like a Hollywood hacker movie.</li>
<li>[**cmatrix**](https://github.com/abishekvashok/cmatrix) – Matrix-style falling characters in terminal. Feel like a bioinformatics hacker.</li>
</ul>
